study_plan_entry.title: Basic principles of drug action at the nervous system

free_text.Learning outcomes: The aim of this course is two-fold:[br/]i) to describe the molecular properties of some important drug targets[br/]ii) to illustrate some applications of drugs active at the nervous system
free_text.Content: Basic Principles of drug action at the nervous system[br/]1) Pharmacology of the cholinergic and adrenergic system 2h, SCotecchia[br/]2) Molecular pharmacology of G protein-coupled-receptors 4h, SCotecchia[br/]3) Molecular pharmacology of ion channels 2h, SKellenberger[br/]4) Pharmacology of pain 2h, SKellenberger[br/]5) Pharmacology of GABA receptors 2h, SKellenberger[br/]6) Anti-convulsant drugs 2h, SKellenberger
free_text.Required prior knowledge: Basic knowledge of biochemistry, physiology and neurobiology

en.title: Basic principles of drug action at the nervous system

free_text.Contenu: Basic Principles of drug action at the nervous system[br/]1) Pharmacology of the cholinergic and adrenergic system 2h, SCotecchia[br/]2) Molecular pharmacology of G protein-coupled-receptors 4h, SCotecchia[br/]3) Molecular pharmacology of ion channels 2h, SKellenberger[br/]4) Pharmacology of pain 2h, SKellenberger[br/]5) Pharmacology of GABA receptors 2h, SKellenberger[br/]6) Anti-convulsant drugs 2h, SKellenberger
free_text.Prérequis: Basic knowledge of biochemistry, physiology and neurobiology
free_text.Objectifs d'apprentissage: The aim of this course is two-fold:[br/]i) to describe the molecular properties of some important drug targets[br/]ii) to illustrate some applications of drugs active at the nervous and cardiovascular systems

fr.title: Basic principles of drug action at the nervous system
